intro: Armeria andicola, commonly known as the Andean thrift, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent and drought-tolerant species. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Armeria andicola is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
